snippet: Wall Street bankers and foreign finance ministers are waging a campaign to block American financial regulators from extending their policing powers far beyond the nation’s shores.
abstract: Banks and overseas regulators are spending millions to weaken or block new government financial regulations, including more oversight of financial instruments known as derivatives, designed to curtail risky trading practices blamed for 2008 financial crisis; effort is just one front in battle still being waged nearly three years after Congress passed Dodd-Frank law.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street bankers and foreign finance ministers are waging a campaign to block American financial regulators from extending their policing powers far beyond the nation’s shores.

headline.seo: Banks Criticize Strict Controls for Foreign Bets
headline.main: Banks Rally Against Strict Controls of Foreign Bets
headline.print_headline: Banks Resist Strict Controls Of Foreign Bets

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
